document.docAuthor: Johanson, Kjell Arne & Holzenthal, Ralph W.
document.docTitle: Helicopsyche (Feropsyche) neblinensis Johanson & Holzenthal, 2004, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Thirteen new species and new distribution records of Helicopsyche (Feropsyche) Johanson from Venezuela (Trichoptera: Helicopsychidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Thirteen new species and new distribution records of Helicopsyche (Feropsyche) Johanson from Venezuela (Trichoptera: Helicopsychidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Together with
H . lara
, new species ,
H . neblinensis
has a rounded, triangular gonocoxite, the form being unique for the American
Helicopsyche
.
Helicopsyche neblinensis
can be separated from
H . lara
, in dorsal view, by the slightly more slender tergum X having only five pairs of dorsal setae, and in lateral view, by the slightly wider gonocoxite.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 41–47.
Helicopsyche neblinensis
, new species , holotype. 41—sternum VI process, lateral; 42—sternum VI process, ventral; 43—male genitalia, lateral; 44—male genitalia, dorsal; 45— male genitalia, ventral; 46—phallus, lateral; 47—phallus, ventral.

subSubSection.paragraph:

Cerro de la Neblina, Basecamp,
0° 51 'N
,
66 ° 10 'W
, 140 m ,
13–15 .iii. 1984
, O.S. Flint, Jr. & J. Louton ( NMNH , pinned).

Etymology.
neblinensis
, derived from the type locality, Cerro de la Neblina. The name is to be treated as a noun in the genitive case.
